intro: Orthocarpus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender orthocarpus, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
